thread.title: Ronnie Moran dead: Jamie Carragher and Ian Rush lead tributes to former Liverpool captain and coach
thread.title_full: Ronnie Moran dead: Jamie Carragher and Ian Rush lead tributes to former Liverpool captain and coach

author: Jack de Menezes
title: Ronnie Moran dead: Jamie Carragher and Ian Rush lead tributes to former Liverpool captain and coach
text:
Former Liverpool football captain and coach (28 February 1934 - 22 March 2017) Getty 
Former F1 and motorbike world champion (11 February 1934-10 March 2017) Getty 
Former Australia international rugby union player (20 February 1971 – 6 February 2017) Getty 4/5 Joost van der Westhuizen, 45 
Former South Africa international rugby union player (20 February 1971 – 6 February 2017) Getty 
Former England international women's cricketer (11 June 1939 – 18 January 2017) Getty 
They read: “Liverpool Football Club is deeply saddened by the passing of Ronnie Moran. 
“Rest in peace, Ronnie.” — Liverpool FC (@LFC) March 22, 2017 Rest in peace, Ronnie. pic.twitter.com/QeCCrIGqi8 — Liverpool FC (@LFC) March 22, 2017 
Former Liverpool defender Carragher was one of the first to take to Twitter to express his sadness after hearing of Moran’s passing, and credited him with teaching many of Liverpool’s past players “an awful lot” that has helped them forge successful careers on the pitch. 
Very sad news with the passing of Ronnie Moran this morning, a legendary figure @LFC & learnt me & others an awful lot. R.I.P,” Carragher wrote. Very sad news with the passing of Ronnie Moran this morning, a legendary figure @LFC & learnt me & others an awful lot. R.I.P. — Jamie Carragher (@Carra23) March 22, 2017 
Liverpool’s Merseyside rivals, Everton, also took time to pay tribute to Moran, with their Twitter account posting a message of condolence. Liverpool play Everton in their next Premier League fixture on 1 April in the Merseyside derby, where the clubs are likely to pay tribute to the former left-back. 
“We are deeply saddened at the passing of a Merseyside football great, Ronnie Moran. Our thoughts are with his family and friends,” the Everton Twitter post read. We are deeply saddened at the passing of a Merseyside football great, Ronnie Moran. Our thoughts are with his family and friends. pic.twitter.com/RHEgtxOKbA
